column4: how can i tell which device file is corresponding to a usb drive?
great, i dont even know what im talking about
i wish i knew where the fstab is, and what it is. im still struggling with most of this stuff, and hit a road block on that tutorial
hmm. so much for that, now im stuck on the tutorial
run command "sudo fdisk -l" (that's a lower case L), that will list all the partitions.
you could also try command "mount", which will list all mounted partitions (but will include some non-disk virtual partitions as well)
and will not include anything that's not mounted (while fdisk will)
thanks. so as for a usb, fdisk is telling me that /dev/sdb is the corresponding file for my usb drive, right?
well, i don't know what it is telling you, because i don't see the output... :) but that sounds reasonable
it looks good on my side. i think, lol
just to let you know, im following a tutorial. right now, im at the part where im about to 'repartition my usb drive'
ah, i see. :) well, i would suggest you mount it first, and make sure that its contents are what you think they are, before you do any actual repartitioning. :)
